title: Nalin Wadhwa
text:
Email
  
  
      Scholar
  
  
    
     GitHub
  
  
    
     Twitter
  

  
  
Hi,
I’m a PhD student at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. My research focuses on building robust and verifiable AI systems, and studying large language models (LLMs) via the lens of formal methods.
I believe we can use formal tools and symbolic techniques to understand and provide guarantees on model behavior. I am currently working towards deterministic verification and robustness of large language models.
I have also worked on Machine Learning for Software Engineering (ML4SE), including automated program repair, code generation, and LLM-based coding agents for complex software development tasks. Broadly, I’m excited about bridging formal methods, machine learning, and software engineering to create AI systems that are both powerful and trustworthy.
Previously, I was a Research Fellow at Microsoft Research India, where I worked with Dr. Sriram Rajamani, Dr. Aditya Kanade, and Dr. Nagarajan Natarajan. I received my B.Tech in Computer Science from IIT Delhi in 2023, where I worked with Prof. Sorav Bansal on my undergraduate thesis.
Outside of research, I enjoy cooking, making electronic music, and can play almost all racket sports. I also like reading fiction, philosophy and everything in between.
I grew up in various cities across India, but my roots are in Delhi.


Microsoft Research India | Research Fellow | Jul 2023 - Jun 2025
Microsoft IDC | Data and Applied Science Intern | Jun 2022 - Jul 2022



University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign | PhD in Computer Science | 2025 - Present
